snippet: The collapsed candidacies in New York are jarring for gay rights advocates who had hoped to use the elections to persuade other Republicans to cross the aisle on the issue.
abstract: Only one of four Republican state senators in New York who agreed to break with their party and cast a politically risky vote to legalize same-sex marriage will be sworn back into office in January, despite vows from Gov Andrew M Cuomo, Mayor Bloomberg and gay rights advocates to protect them from political retribution; collapsed candidacies have jarred gay rights advocates who had hoped to use the elections to persuade other Republicans to cross the aisle on the issue.
lead_paragraph: The collapsed candidacies in New York are jarring for gay rights advocates who had hoped to use the elections to persuade other Republicans to cross the aisle on the issue.

headline.seo: In Final Tally, Vote for Gay Marriage Costs 3 Republicans
headline.main: Costly Toll for Republicans Who Voted for Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Costly Toll for Republicans Who Voted for Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
